abstract: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation on Wednesday extended for one year a moratorium on considering nonfinancial companies’ applications to establish or acquire banks. The decision suspends applications from companies like Wal-Mart Stores, Home Depot and DaimlerChrysler, and gives Congress time to consider legislation that would prohibit them from running their own lending banks, called industrial loan corporations.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation on Wednesday extended for one year a moratorium on considering nonfinancial companies’ applications to establish or acquire banks. The decision suspends applications from companies like Wal-Mart Stores, Home Depot and DaimlerChrysler, and gives Congress time to consider legislation that would prohibit them from running their own lending banks, called industrial loan corporations.

headline.main: Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Extends Moratorium
